contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2012}} '''XXIII Corps''' was a [[corps]] of the [[Union Army]] during the [[American Civil War]]. It served in the [[Western Theater of the American Civil War|Western Theater]] as part of the [[Army of the Ohio]]. The corps was organized in April 1863 by order of the departmental commander, [[Ambrose E. Burnside]]. Along with Burnside's old [[IX Corps (ACW)|IX Corps]], which had been sent west with him after [[Battle of Fredericksburg|Fredericksburg]], it was to maintain a primarily defensive position in Eastern Tennessee and [[Kentucky]]. It originally consisted of two divisions under the overall command of General [[George Lucas Hartsuff|George L. Hartsuff]]. The corps played a major role during the [[Knoxville Campaign]], its first major action, distinguishing itself at the battles of [[Battle of Campbell's Station|Campbell's Station]] and [[Battle of Fort Sanders|Knoxville]], and also took part in some minor actions in early 1864. During this time it was commanded by [[Major General|Maj. Gen.]] [[Mahlon D. Manson]]. The [[Army of the Ohio]] joined [[William T. Sherman]] for the [[Atlanta Campaign]] that spring. IX Corps was detached and sent back to rejoin the [[Army of the Potomac]], so the "army" consisted entirely of XXIII Corps, now commanded by [[John M. Schofield]]. It served ably if unspectacularly throughout the campaign. In the fall of 1864, it was sent north to counter [[John B. Hood]]'s [[Franklin-Nashville Campaign]], and it saw heavy action at the [[Battle of Franklin]], though it was held in reserve at [[Battle of Nashville|Nashville]]. After this campaign, the corps was sent east to serve in the Department of the South; it took part in the capture of [[Second Battle of Fort Fisher|Fort Fisher]] and the [[Battle of Wilmington|seizure of Wilmington, North Carolina]] (the last open port of the South). During this time it was commanded by Maj. Gen. [[Jacob D. Cox]]. The corps ultimately joined Sherman's army in the [[Carolinas Campaign]], and was disbanded in August 1865. ==Command history== {| cellpadding=3 | [[George Lucas Hartsuff|George L.
